summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackMidnight Recovery Eye Cream is a restorative, nighttime eye cream by Kiehl's Since 1851 for younger-looking eyes by morning.
details: DetailsBenefitsHelps diminish the appearance of dark circles and eye puffinessLeaves the eye area feeling strengthened and replenishedSmooths and restores the area while you sleepKey IngredientsButcher's Broom Extract: known to help reduce under-eye puffinessLavender Essential Oil: steam-distilled from Lavender, known for its soothing and calming propertiesEvening Primrose Oil: frequently used in herbal remedies, it's known to help maintain skin hydration and elasticityItem 2536678How To UseDispense 1- 2 drops onto fingertips. Gently pat under the eye, along the orbital bone. Can be used morning and night.IngredientsAqua/Water, Helianthus Annuus Seed Oil/Sunflower Seed Oil, Simmondsia Chinensis Oil/Jojoba Seed Oil, Prunus Armeniaca Kernel Oil/Apricot Kernel Oil, Squalane, Alcohol Denat., Cetearyl Alcohol, Glyceryl Stearate, Stearyl Alcohol, Cetearyl Glucoside, Oenothera Biennis Oil/Evening Primrose Oil, Butyrospermum Parkii Butter/Shea Butter, Phenoxyethanol, Lithium Magnesium Sodium Silicate, Chlorphenesin, Xanthan Gum, Ruscus Aculeatus Root Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice Powder, Tocopherol, Lavandula Angustifolia Oil/Lavender Oil, Adenosine, Linalool, Rosmarinus Officinalis Leaf Oil/Rosemary Leaf Oil, Pelargonium Graveolens Flower Oil, Glycine Soja Oil/Soybean Oil, Citronellol, Geraniol, Lavandula Hybrida Oil, Cucumis Sativus Fruit Extract/Cucumber Fruit Extract, Limonene, Citral, Curcuma Longa Root Extract/Turmeric Root Extract, Sclareolide, Rose Flower Oil, Jasminum Officinale Extract/Jasmine Extract, Citric Acid.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Dispense 1- 2 drops onto fingertips. Gently pat under the eye, along the orbital bone. Can be used morning and night.
ingredients: Helianthus Annuus Seed Oil/Sunflower Seed Oil
Prunus Armeniaca Kernel Oil/Apricot Kernel Oil
Rosmarinus Officinalis Leaf Oil/Rosemary Leaf Oil
Cucumis Sativus Fruit Extract/Cucumber Fruit Extract
Curcuma Longa Root Extract/Turmeric Root Extract

reviews.headline: My go-to
reviews.comments: Yes, it's on the pricier side but trust - this works. I moved away from it due to the price...several products later & an allergic reaction, I'm back! And if I still haven't convinced you, this is coming from a 52 yo woman who's had hereditary dark circles since birth ;)

reviews.headline: love
reviews.comments: love this eye cream sm. a bit pricey for the size of the product, but 100% worth it.

reviews.headline: sample converted me
reviews.comments: I received this in sample size and am now in love. I did not pay high prices for self care products until this. I will not go without again.

reviews.headline: The best
reviews.comments: I swear by this eye cream. I got a sample when I purchased my face wash and haven't stopped buying it since

reviews.headline: My EYEBROWS GREW BACK
reviews.comments: I hadn't had any eyebrows for years from over plucking them as a teenager. I started using this and spread it over my brow line and in a few weeks more than 50% of my brows grew back! Plus, this stuff did wonders for the luggage under my eyes!

reviews.headline: Dark circles? Get this!
reviews.comments: I have used sooo many eye creams. I have sensitive skin, mature skin with dark circles. This is the only eye cream that will actually make a difference if you use it consistently. I'm going back to it because I changed and my dark circles are worse than ever!

reviews.headline: Too much perfume
reviews.comments: I received the small sample tube, along with the oil. Upon opening, you're immediately blasted with a heavy perfume odor. I am highly sensitive to scents, cannot wear or be around people who wear perfume. I did try it, hoping the scent would dissipate. It does lesson, but not enough and gave me a headache. I also didn't wake up looking youthful (probably because I had a headache all night from the scent). I can't recommend. Sorry.

reviews.headline: Not impressed
reviews.comments: Just like most eye creams it claims to have big results and Is a complete failure. I got more results from Olay than this products. Huge thumbs down.

reviews.headline: Very nice eye cream
reviews.comments: I have gone back to this eye cream after trying quite a few for my dark circles.  This one works fairly well, it leaves the area nicely moisturized and I do think it helps to slightly lessen my dark circles.  Frankly, the only thing that will REALLY work is fillers at my age (51) but I really want to avoid that.  The caffeinated eye creams just make my under eye more crepey so those are out.  Several of the more expensive creams that promise to help with dark circles do nothing.  I think this cream is nicely priced for how little it takes and how long the tube lasts and the fact that it actually does work, even if it's not dramatic.  I don't find the scent to be noticeable, as others have described.  I'll continue to purchase it.

reviews.headline: Excellent Eye Cream!
reviews.comments: I use this every night and have for a few years.  This is a great product and though a little expensive one tube last a long time.  Excellent!

reviews.headline: Yes if you pair it with the oil
reviews.comments: My skin/under eyes are at their best when I use this eye cream WITH the midnight recovery oil. I honestly think they best when put together.

reviews.headline: No no no
reviews.comments: Save your money it doesn't work. Had it for a year and didn't see results. say YES coconut under eye cream is the best!

reviews.headline: It's Working
reviews.comments: I've been using this cream most nights for two weeks.  It goes on easy with no weird feeling to it.  I can already see a difference.  The dark circles under my eyes have lightened up, and the skin just looks more supple.  YAY!

reviews.headline: Less tired looking eyes
reviews.comments: I've been trying a few different products to help my eyes from looking less tired and puffy, while also balancing naturally sourced ingredients. This so far seems to be a good balance. The puffiness did seem subtly better the next morning, but not super dramatic as far as I could tell. It did take a couple weeks for really noticeable and sustained differences, but my under eye area is much less puffy and fatigued looking. It applies smooth and leaves a silky, hydrated feeling. I don't have an issue with dark circles, so I can't comment on that but I think it helps with fine lines too (I don't have much of those yet either). You only need a very tiny amount, like half a pea size for both eyes. I began just using it nightly for the first week, no adverse reactions, and now use it morning and night with more noticeable results. I plan to be a repeat buyer with this.

reviews.headline: Heavy scent
reviews.comments: I received a small sample. It goes on smooth. I didn't notice a reduction in dark circles. What it does have is a very strong perfume smell. I'm very sensitive to odors and cannot wear perfumes.It's too bad this wasn't  an unscented product.  I could not use this product.

reviews.headline: Didn't do much
reviews.comments: It really didn't do much to my under eye circles which sucks Bc it doesn't come highly recommended. Going to try out Kiehls avocado eye cream bc I've also heard great things.

reviews.headline: Fragrance in a tube
reviews.comments: I used this every night for 3 months trying to mitigate my dark under eyes and little bumps (not milia, I checked). Did absolutely nothing and made the bumps even worse and added redness, irritation, and even a little bit of peeling. It was only until I starting digging deep into skincare products and ingredients that I found how unnecessary and even HARMFUL fragrance and essential oils can be in skincare! I don't know why companies are allowed to put sooooo much fragrance and essential oils in a product, ESPECIALLY for the delicate under eye area! Please do not use this or the Midnight Recovery Concentrate oil, especially if you are sensitive to fragrances.

reviews.headline: Kathleen Lights Recommendation but..
reviews.comments: I've been looking for a eye cream that'll brighten and moisturize my under eyes. (Dark circles) I have tried sooo many it's not even funny. I bought this one per recommendation of Kathleen Lights but unfortunately I have noticed absolutely nothing. Everyone is different so I'm sure it works for some people but I've used it day and night every day for about two months now and needless to say I am still on the hunt for a eye cream that'll work for me :(

reviews.headline: The only eye cream that's worked for me
reviews.comments: No other eye creams have helped my genetic/allergy dark circles until this one. Doesn't irritate my eyes at all and smells nice too. A little expensive but worth it.

reviews.headline: Dark Circles have lessened GREATLY!
reviews.comments:
I developed dark circles @ 33yo, I'm now 46yo so I have been searching for a good while for something to help! I've been using This & their "Youth Dose Eye Treatment" since late October 2019. Around December 2019, I began to notice that my dark circles looked much lighter... the kinda shade where I found no need to wear concealer- "maybe" a little if I wanted to look Flawless BUT I seriously haven't even bothered! It has to be THIS as nothing else has changed in my regimen. And I have NOT had these results ever before. To make sure it wasn't all in my head I asked my husband- He absolutely agreed. He remembers how my dark circles looked- so I'm not imagining things LoL! There is a little shade but it's natural looking but NOT compared to what it was before! On a scale of 1-5... My dark circles were a 3. I really didn't think Kiel's would help at all just like the countless others that claim they do and DON'T! - BUT ALAST I have found it!!! Again, I do also use the other eye cream they make as well. 1.) Midnite Recovery @ nite and 2.) Youth Dose during the day. They both have made a Big difference. It took 2.5 mons to experience results but I'm saying YES everyday to No under eye concealer and to feeling like OH YES I LOOK GOOD! 
I feel so much better about the way I look; it's been so long that I've felt this confident again.
For reference I'm a medium skin tone & don't get as much sleep as I should LoL!

faceoff_positive.comments: My brother bought me this for Christmas and I could not be happier with this product. The texture is silky smooth and luxurious! I've noticed a significant change around my eyes and even my laugh lines have smoothed out. The tube is a little small, but it goes far. I will definitely be purchasing this again!
faceoff_positive.headline: Excellent product!

faceoff_negative.comments: One of my favorite beauty youtubers recommended this for reducing dark under eye circles and she basically swore by it so I had to get it to try for myself. I was kind of desperate to try this because I have really bad dark circles.. Not even from lack of sleep but just because that's the color of my undereyes always (for whatever reason). Well to get to the point I bought this cream and the scent was so gorgeous and a little does go a long way. However the cream seemed to do nothing for my undereye dark circles and I've been testing it out for about a month now, night and day! I also have very fine lines around that area (I'm only 22) but they seemed to remain the same. I can't say whether or not this product helped with undereye puffiness because have none. But I just wanted to share my experience in case any of you were hesitant on spending the 36 or so dollars and have the same undereye situation as me. I will continue using the bottle up because the scent I s really soothing and I'm hoping it will magically work one day.. But nothing yet. Also, even after about a month of using twice a day I still have so much product left.. So it will probably take me another two months or so to use it up completely. Hope this helped!
faceoff_negative.headline: So disappointed :(
